TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TaskFactory extends System.Object

remarks.para: The class encodes some common patterns into methods that pick up default settings, which are configurable through its constructors. A default instance of is available through the property.

summary.para: Provides support for creating and scheduling objects.

MemberSignature.Value: public TaskFactory ();
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

remarks.para: This constructor creates a instance with a default configuration. The property is initialized to , the property is initialized to , and the property is initialized to the current scheduler (see ).

summary.para: Initializes a instance with the default configuration.

remarks.para: This constructor creates a instance with a default configuration. The property is initialized to , the property is initialized to , and the property is initialized to the current scheduler (see ).

summary.para: Initializes a instance with the specified configuration.

Docs.param: The that will be assigned to tasks created by this unless another CancellationToken is explicitly specified while calling the factory methods.

MemberSignature.Value: public TaskFactory (System.Threading.Tasks.TaskScheduler scheduler);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Threading.Tasks.TaskScheduler scheduler) cil managed

remarks.para: With this constructor, the property is initialized to , the property is initialized to , and the property is initialized to , unless it's null, in which case the property is initialized to the current scheduler (see ).

summary.para: Initializes a instance with the specified configuration.

Docs.param: The to use to schedule any tasks created with this TaskFactory. A null value indicates that the current TaskScheduler should be used.

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken, valuetype System.Threading.Tasks.TaskCreationOptions creationOptions, valuetype System.Threading.Tasks.TaskContinuationOptions continuationOptions, class System.Threading.Tasks.TaskScheduler scheduler) cil managed

remarks.para: With this constructor, the property is initialized to , the property is initialized to , and the property is initialized to , unless it's null, in which case the property is initialized to the current scheduler (see ).

summary.para: Initializes a instance with the specified configuration.

Docs.param: The default that will be assigned to tasks created by this unless another CancellationToken is explicitly specified while calling the factory methods.
The default to use when creating tasks with this TaskFactory.
The default to use when creating continuation tasks with this TaskFactory.
The default to use to schedule any Tasks created with this TaskFactory. A null value indicates that TaskScheduler.Current should be used.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.CancellationToken CancellationToken { get; }
.property instance valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken CancellationToken

remarks.para: This property returns the default that will be assigned to all tasks created by this factory, unless another value is explicitly specified during the call to the factory methods.

summary.para: Gets the default cancellation token for this task factory.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.TaskContinuationOptions ContinuationOptions { get; }
.property instance valuetype System.Threading.Tasks.TaskContinuationOptions ContinuationOptions

remarks.para: The property value is used to create all continuation tasks, unless other options are explicitly specified during calls to this factory's methods.

summary.para: Gets the default task continuation options for this task factory.

public System.Threading.Tasks.TaskScheduler Scheduler { get; }
.property instance class System.Threading.Tasks.TaskScheduler Scheduler

remarks.para: The property value is used to schedule all tasks, unless another scheduler is explicitly specified during calls to this factory's methods.
If this property value is null, the value of the property is used.

summary.para: Gets the default task scheduler for this task factory.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task StartNew (Action action);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task StartNew(class System.Action action) cil managed

remarks.para: Calling is functionally equivalent to creating a task by using one of its constructors, and then calling the method to schedule the task for execution. Starting with the net_v45, you can use the method with an object as a quick way to call with default parameters. For more information and code examples, see Task.Run vs Task.Factory.StartNew in the Parallel Programming with .NET blog.

Docs.param: The action delegate to execute asynchronously.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task StartNew (Action action, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task StartNew(class System.Action action, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

remarks.para: Calling StartNew is functionally equivalent to creating a Task using one of its constructors and then calling to schedule it for execution. Starting with the net_v45, you can use the method with an object as a quick way to call with default parameters. For more information and code examples, see Task.Run vs Task.Factory.StartNew in the Parallel Programming with .NET blog.

Docs.param: The action delegate to execute asynchronously.
The that will be assigned to the new task.
